author: Kathleen Overman

review: The Amazon Fire is a good system.  I previously owned a Roku but am an Amazon Prime member.  I thought that when one purchased the Amazon Fire one received a free year of Prime.  That apparently was not the case.  I am having difficulty separating prime shows from pay ones.  This was not an issue on the Roku.  I am still learning the Fire's features and hope this will be one area that will get easier to use. I do enjoy the voice search feature.

author: james patrick withey

review: We are using this with a fiber optic connection.  The movies and TV shows work great.  No pauses or blips.  Music videos not so much.  I was actually looking for music streaming and could only get the videos, even when I asked for "Christmas Music" it came up with only videos.  I found the music one day and the next day, only videos.  Looked for it in the same way.  Since we do not have cable or satellite, this box is awesome.  I bought the game controller, only 1 and it is not as accurate as some, but it works great with the games that are available.  So far, I have just checked out the "free" stuff that comes with prime.  For the price, it is a good investment if you have fast internet.
